title: Softeng
details: Design, develop, test, and deploy software solutions based on business requirements.
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to deliver high-quality software.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following best practices.

title: Scaffolder
details: Assemble and dismantle scaffolding structures in accordance with industry safety standards.
Inspect scaffolding for stability and security before use.
Ensure scaffolding materials are transported and stored properly.

title: Trader
details: Execute trades in financial markets, including stocks, bonds, currencies, and derivatives.
Monitor market trends, economic data, and financial news to identify profitable opportunities.
Analyze risk and implement strategies to mitigate potential losses.
education: Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Finance or Economics

title: Marketing-Manager
details: Develop, implement, and execute strategic marketing plans for an entire organization.
Lead and motivate a team of marketing professionals to achieve business goals.
Monitor market trends and oversee advertising and marketing activities to ensure the right message is delivered.

title: CustomerServiceRepresentative
details: Handle customer inquiries, complaints, billing questions and payment extension/service requests.
Calm angry callers, repair trust, locate resources for problem resolution and design best-option solutions.
Interface daily with internal partners in accounting, field services, new business, operations and consumer affairs divisions.

title: ProjectManager
details: Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects.
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget.
Develop project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility.
education: Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related field

title: GraphicDesigner
details: Conceptualize visuals based on requirements.
Prepare rough drafts and present ideas.
Develop illustrations, logos and other designs using software or by hand.

title: HRSpecialist
details: Recruit, screen, interview and place workers.
Handle employee relations, payroll, benefits, and training.
Plan, direct and coordinate the administrative functions of an organization.

title: DataAnalyst
details: Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
education: Bachelor's Degree in Statistics or Mathematics

title: NetworkAdministrator
details: Maintain computer networks and systems including software, VPNs, routers and other physical hardware.
Install and configure network equipment to update or fix hardware or software issues.
Monitor computer systems to improve network performance for computer systems and networks.

title: WebDeveloper
details: Build and maintain websites and web applications.
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.

title: LegalAssistant
details: Prepare legal documents and case briefs.
Assist attorneys in preparing for trials and court proceedings.
Organize and maintain documents in a paper or electronic filing system.

title: Business Analyst
details: Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement.
Perform requirements analysis, document and communicate the results.
Effectively communicate insights and plans to cross-functional team members.

title: Sales Manager
details: Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully managing the sales team.
Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands the company's customer base.
Present sales, revenue, and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to the management team.

title: Content Writer
details: Create content for blogs, articles, product descriptions, social media, and the company website.
Proofread content for errors and inconsistencies.
Edit and polish existing content to improve readability.
education: Bachelor's Degree in English or Communications

title: Accountant
details: Prepare asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information.
Summarize current financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet, profit and loss statement, and other reports.
Audit documents and prepare financial statements that comply with laws, regulations, and accepted accounting principles.

title: Restaurant Manager
details: Coordinate daily Front of the House and Back of the House restaurant operations.
Deliver superior service and maximize customer satisfaction.
Regularly review product quality and research new vendors.
education: Diploma in Hospitality or Culinary Management

title: System Administrator
details: Install and configure software and hardware.
Manage network servers and technology tools.
Set up accounts and workstations.
education: Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or similar

title: Civil Engineer
details: Analyze survey reports, maps, and other data to plan projects.
Consider construction costs, government regulations, potential environmental hazards, and other factors in planning stages and risk analysis.
Oversee and analyze the results of soil testing to determine the adequacy and strength of foundations.

title: Pharmacist
details: Dispense prescription medications to patients and offer expertise in the safe use of prescriptions.
Review prescriptions to assure accuracy, to ascertain the needed ingredients, and to evaluate their suitability.
Provide information and advice regarding drug interactions, side effects, dosage, and proper medication storage.

title: UX/UI Designer
details: Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Identify design problems and devise elegant solutions.
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
education: Bachelor's Degree in Design or related field

title: Security Analyst
details: Monitor security incidents and provide thorough incident response analysis.
Ensure appropriate security controls are in place that will safeguard digital files and vital electronic infrastructure.
Respond to computer security breaches and viruses.
education: Bachelor's Degree in Information Security or related field

title: Event Planner
details: Coordinate all event activities and personnel.
Distribute all meeting information and supplies to attending personnel.
Plan and organize large scale events, including festivals, conferences, and weddings.

title: Real Estate Agent
details: Assist clients in buying, selling, and renting properties.
Advise clients on market conditions, prices, mortgages, legal requirements and related matters.
Promote sales through advertisements, open houses, and listing services.
